page.title: 10Interviews with the "locals"
page.content: Mrs Fearn told us she used to go to the old school in Fritchley. There was no hot water, and there wasn't a canteen. She started school when she was 5 and left when she was 14. when she did cooking she had to walk to the Parish rooms at Crich. Mr Jackson told us there were 3 shops in Fritchley, but now there is only 1, which is Richardsons. The house next door to Richardsons shop used to be a butchers shop, and the house next to the Red Lion Inn used to be a Grocery store. There are more people in the village now than when these Ladies were little. For instance, Dale Close used to be a field, but now it is a large area.
